properties.name: name
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that represents the name of the font.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that represents the font size in points.

properties.name: bold
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is bold. True if the font is formatted as bold, otherwise, false.

properties.name: italic
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is italicized. True if the font is italicized, otherwise, false.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Gets or sets the color for the specified font. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format or the color name.

properties.name: underline
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates the font's underline type. 'None' if the font is not underlined.

properties.name: subscript
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is a subscript. True if the font is formatted as subscript, otherwise, false.

properties.name: superscript
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is a superscript. True if the font is formatted as superscript, otherwise, false.

properties.name: strikeThrough
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font has a strike through. True if the font is formatted as strikethrough text, otherwise, false.

properties.name: doubleStrikeThrough
properties.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font has a double strike through. True if the font is formatted as double strikethrough text, otherwise, false.

properties.name: highlightColor
properties.description: Gets or sets the highlight color. To set it, use a value either in the '#RRGGBB' format or the color name. To remove highlight color, set it to null. The returned highlight color can be in the '#RRGGBB' format, or an empty string for mixed highlight colors, or null for no highlight color.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Fills the proxy object created in JavaScript layer with property and object values specified in the parameter.

parameters.name: param
parameters.description: Accepts parameter and relationship names as delimited string or an array. Or, provide [loadOption](loadoption.md) object.
